fields.name: Ueno Park
fields.description: A large public park in central Tokyo, home to museums, shrines, and a zoo. Famous for cherry blossoms in spring, lush greenery in summer, vibrant autumn leaves, and a peaceful winter landscape.

fields.name: Fuji Five Lakes
fields.description: A scenic area near Mount Fuji, offering stunning cherry blossoms in spring, lakeside activities in summer, breathtaking autumn colors, and a view of snow-covered Mount Fuji in winter.

fields.name: Gion Matsuri - Kyoto
fields.description: One of Japanâ€™s most famous festivals, held in Kyoto every July. It features grand parades, traditional performances, and lively summer celebrations.

fields.name: Nachi Fire Festival
fields.description: A spectacular summer festival where monks carry massive torches up the steps of Nachi Shrine, symbolizing purification and tradition.

fields.name: Arashiyama Bamboo Grove
fields.description: A stunning bamboo forest in Kyoto, offering an ethereal experience with towering bamboo trees. Beautiful in every season, from spring blossoms to misty winter mornings.

fields.name: Nikko National Park
fields.description: Famous for its vibrant autumn foliage, but also offers hiking trails, waterfalls, and scenic beauty all year round.

fields.name: Sapporo Snow Festival
fields.description: A world-famous winter festival in Hokkaido, featuring massive snow sculptures and ice displays. Best visited in February.

fields.name: Jigokudani Monkey Park
fields.description: A famous hot spring park where wild Japanese macaques (snow monkeys) bathe in the steaming waters. Open year-round but most iconic in winter.
